// Code generated by github.com/bckground/go-options. DO NOT EDIT.
// Source: configWithDifferentPrefix{}
//
// Generated by this command:
//
//	go-options -namespace=MyOptNs -option=MyOpt configWithDifferentPrefix
//

package test

import "fmt"

import "github.com/google/go-cmp/cmp"

type ApplyMyOptFunc func(c *configWithDifferentPrefix) error

func (f ApplyMyOptFunc) apply(c *configWithDifferentPrefix) error {
	return f(c)
}

func newConfigWithDifferentPrefix(options ...MyOpt) (configWithDifferentPrefix, error) {
	var c configWithDifferentPrefix
	err := applyConfigWithDifferentPrefixOptions(&c, options...)
	return c, err
}

func applyConfigWithDifferentPrefixOptions(c *configWithDifferentPrefix, options ...MyOpt) error {
	for _, o := range options {
		if err := o.apply(c); err != nil {
			return err
		}
	}
	return nil
}

type MyOpt interface {
	apply(*configWithDifferentPrefix) error
}

type myOptNamespace struct{}

var MyOptNs myOptNamespace

type myOptMyFloatImpl struct {
	o float64
}

func (o myOptMyFloatImpl) apply(c *configWithDifferentPrefix) error {
	c.myFloat = o.o
	return nil
}

func (o myOptMyFloatImpl) Equal(v myOptMyFloatImpl) bool {
	switch {
	case !cmp.Equal(o.o, v.o):
		return false
	}
	return true
}

func (o myOptMyFloatImpl) String() string {
	name := "MyFloat"

	// hack to avoid go vet error about passing a function to Sprintf
	var value interface{} = o.o
	return fmt.Sprintf("%s: %+v", name, value)
}

func (myOptNamespace) MyFloat(o float64) MyOpt {
	return myOptMyFloatImpl{
		o: o,
	}
}
